laboratory_examinations.findings: Largely normal acral-site epidermis with superficial dermal fibrosis, reactive angioplasia, scattered foci of microhemorrhage, and sparse perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate. Direct immunofluorescence studies revealed smooth IgG, weak IgA, weak IgM, and C3 binding in the superficial vessel walls. Weak linear IgG deposition was observed along the dermoepidermal junction, compatible with a porphyria immune deposition pattern.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Genetic testing with Invitae Comprehensive Porphyrias Panel
laboratory_examinations.findings: Heterozygous variant of uncertain significance in the PPOX gene (variant c.23T>C [p.Leu8Pro]).
